review: It took me awhile to figure out how to use this gizmo, but it works OK.  Somehow I got the impression that I could watch everything from my computer, like Facebook, e-mail and MSN and Yahoo News on the TV. This turned out not to be true. Programs have to have a special app to be compatible. I read that there are many more apps to come, but if they are anything like those they currently have available, they can keep them. So far, I can only watch YouTube. We'll see what the future brings.
author: Wise Man "flawed classic"

review: Works just like I spected, faster with google apps little slow with others but does the job, and the quality to the screen is really good.

review: Works well and very easy to connect.  Make sure your TV has an HDMI and a USB port.  If not, you can use HDMI and the power supply cord.It is controlled using your phone via a chromecast app and it still has very few apps that work with it but I can see potential for bigger things.  I currently does not mirror your phone.  It just gives you a new button on apps like YouTube, Netflix, Vevo, Pandora, to cast to your TV.  Your phone must also be on your home wifi network as well as the chromecast.

review: I can't get it to work with my laptop and I'm an advanced computer user.  But my network set-up is complex, too.
